categoryDescriptions.anxiety: Anxiety disorders are characterized by excessive fear or worry that disrupts daily activities.
categoryDescriptions.mood: Mood disorders primarily affect an individual's emotional state, including disorders like depression and bipolar disorder.
categoryDescriptions.psychotic: Psychotic disorders involve distorted thinking and awareness, often including hallucinations or delusions.
categoryDescriptions.personality: Personality disorders involve enduring patterns of behavior and inner experiences that deviate from societal expectations.
categoryDescriptions.ocd: Obsessive-compulsive and related disorders involve intrusive thoughts and repetitive behaviors.
categoryDescriptions.trauma: These disorders result from exposure to traumatic or stressful events, such as PTSD.
categoryDescriptions.eating: Eating disorders involve unhealthy eating habits and concerns about body weight or shape.
categoryDescriptions.neurodevelopmental: These disorders, typically diagnosed in childhood, affect development and functioning, such as ADHD.
categoryDescriptions.substance: Substance-related and addictive disorders involve the misuse of substances like alcohol or drugs.
categoryDescriptions.somatic: These disorders involve physical symptoms without a clear medical cause, often accompanied by excessive concern about the symptoms.

anxiety.name: Generalized Anxiety Disorder
anxiety.description: Persistent and excessive worry about various aspects of life.

anxiety.name: Panic Disorder
anxiety.description: Recurrent, unexpected panic attacks with intense fear and physical symptoms.

anxiety.name: Social Anxiety Disorder
anxiety.description: Intense fear of social situations due to fear of judgment or embarrassment.

anxiety.name: Specific Phobias
anxiety.description: Intense fear of specific objects or situations, such as heights or animals.

anxiety.name: Separation Anxiety Disorder
anxiety.description: Excessive fear or anxiety about separation from attachment figures.

mood.name: Major Depressive Disorder
mood.description: Persistent sadness and loss of interest in daily activities.

mood.name: Bipolar Disorder
mood.description: Characterized by alternating episodes of depression and mania.

mood.name: Persistent Depressive Disorder (Dysthymia)
mood.description: Chronic low-level depression lasting for at least two years.

mood.name: Cyclothymic Disorder
mood.description: A milder form of bipolar disorder with mood swings that are less severe.

mood.name: Premenstrual Dysphoric Disorder (PMDD)
mood.description: Severe mood changes and irritability related to the menstrual cycle.

psychotic.name: Schizophrenia
psychotic.description: Involves distorted thinking and awareness, often accompanied by hallucinations and delusions.

psychotic.name: Delusional Disorder
psychotic.description: Characterized by persistent delusions without other psychotic symptoms.

psychotic.name: Brief Psychotic Disorder
psychotic.description: Short-term psychotic episodes, often triggered by stress.

psychotic.name: Schizoaffective Disorder
psychotic.description: A combination of schizophrenia symptoms and mood disorder features.

psychotic.name: Substance-Induced Psychotic Disorder
psychotic.description: Psychotic symptoms caused by substance use or withdrawal.

personality.name: Borderline Personality Disorder
personality.description: Intense emotions, unstable relationships, and impulsive behavior.

personality.name: Narcissistic Personality Disorder
personality.description: An inflated sense of self-importance and a lack of empathy for others.

personality.name: Antisocial Personality Disorder
personality.description: Disregard for others' rights, often accompanied by manipulative or criminal behavior.

personality.name: Histrionic Personality Disorder
personality.description: Excessive emotionality and a need for attention.

personality.name: Avoidant Personality Disorder
personality.description: Extreme social inhibition and sensitivity to negative evaluation.

ocd.name: Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder
ocd.description: Recurring, unwanted thoughts (obsessions) and repetitive behaviors (compulsions).

ocd.name: Body Dysmorphic Disorder
ocd.description: Preoccupation with perceived flaws in physical appearance.

ocd.name: Hoarding Disorder
ocd.description: Difficulty discarding items, leading to clutter and distress.

ocd.name: Trichotillomania (Hair-Pulling Disorder)
ocd.description: Recurrent, irresistible urges to pull out one's hair.

ocd.name: Excoriation (Skin-Picking Disorder)
ocd.description: Recurrent skin-picking resulting in lesions and distress.

trauma.name: Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder
trauma.description: Persistent distress following exposure to a traumatic event, with symptoms like flashbacks and avoidance.

trauma.name: Acute Stress Disorder
trauma.description: Short-term stress reactions occurring immediately after a traumatic event.

trauma.name: Adjustment Disorders
trauma.description: Emotional or behavioral symptoms in response to a significant life change or stressor.

trauma.name: Reactive Attachment Disorder
trauma.description: Severe emotional withdrawal and difficulty forming healthy attachments in children.

trauma.name: Disinhibited Social Engagement Disorder
trauma.description: Overly familiar behavior with strangers in children, often resulting from neglect.

eating.name: Anorexia Nervosa
eating.description: Restrictive eating and an intense fear of gaining weight.

eating.name: Bulimia Nervosa
eating.description: Binge eating followed by compensatory behaviors like purging.

eating.name: Binge-Eating Disorder
eating.description: Recurrent episodes of excessive eating without compensatory behaviors.

eating.name: Pica
eating.description: Eating non-nutritive substances such as paper, dirt, or chalk.

eating.name: Rumination Disorder
eating.description: Regurgitation of food that is re-chewed, re-swallowed, or spit out.

neurodevelopmental.name: Autism Spectrum Disorder
neurodevelopmental.description: Challenges with social interaction, communication, and repetitive behaviors.

neurodevelopmental.name: Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD)
neurodevelopmental.description: Characterized by inattention, hyperactivity, and impulsivity that interfere with daily functioning.

neurodevelopmental.name: Tic Disorders
neurodevelopmental.description: Characterized by sudden, repetitive, nonrhythmic movements or sounds.

neurodevelopmental.name: Intellectual Disability
neurodevelopmental.description: Impairments in intellectual functioning and adaptive behavior.

neurodevelopmental.name: Specific Learning Disorders
neurodevelopmental.description: Difficulties in acquiring and using academic skills, such as reading or math.

substance.name: Alcohol Use Disorder
substance.description: Dependence on alcohol characterized by cravings, withdrawal, and tolerance.

substance.name: Opioid Use Disorder
substance.description: Dependence on opioids, such as prescription pain relievers or heroin.

substance.name: Nicotine Dependence
substance.description: Dependence on nicotine, often from tobacco products.

substance.name: Cocaine Use Disorder
substance.description: Compulsive use of cocaine with severe physical and psychological effects.

substance.name: Cannabis Use Disorder
substance.description: Problematic use of marijuana with dependency and withdrawal symptoms.

somatic.name: Somatic Symptom Disorder
somatic.description: Significant focus on physical symptoms leading to distress and impairment.

somatic.name: Illness Anxiety Disorder
somatic.description: Preoccupation with having or developing a serious illness despite minimal symptoms.

somatic.name: Conversion Disorder
somatic.description: Neurological symptoms, such as paralysis or seizures, that lack a medical cause.

somatic.name: Factitious Disorder
somatic.description: Deliberately faking or inducing symptoms to assume a sick role.

somatic.name: Chronic Pain Disorder
somatic.description: Persistent pain that is linked to psychological factors.
